In computer vision based image segmentation, what is the main goal of the algorithm? Choices:
A. segment objects into parts that are disjoint and semantically meaningful
B. segment objects into parts (regions) without taking into account their spatial arrangement
C. determine the probability of regions having certain labels
D. segment a collection of labeled objects
E. segment the entire image into a single label

In computer vision image segmentation is the process of labeling regions in an image into a set of predefined categories, in other words classifying the image into regions of similar properties, either structural or semantic.In this process regions are called objects.
There there are few different types of segmentation, but, here is the focus on regions based segmentation, also called region based image segmentation. This type of algorithm aims to divide a region into subregions.The main goal is to label a set of objects into different classes of interest.
